reasoning: Umbrella term too broad and heterogeneous to estimate meaningfully. This DSM-IV category encompasses delirium (acute, reversible), dementia (chronic, progressive; includes Alzheimer's 70-80%, vascular 15%, Lewy body 5%), amnestic disorders, and other cognitive disorders. Each subcategory has vastly different epidemiology, demographics, and clinical trajectories. Aggregate estimate would not be clinically meaningful.
